definitions.text: the state of having good sense and sound judgment
examples: his rationality may have been impaired
he had to rely less on reason than on rousing their emotions
the judiciary is built on the reasonableness of judges

definitions.text: the property of being moderate in price or expenditures
examples: the store is famous for the reasonableness of its prices
the modestness of the living standards here becomes obvious immediately
without greater reasonableness by both parties we will never settle this matter!

definitions.text: the quality of being plausible or acceptable to a reasonable person
examples: he questioned the tenability of my claims
